intro: Ditassa longisepala, commonly known as the long-sepaled ditassa, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers with four to five petals. It produces small, round fruits that contain several seeds. The species is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and shrublands.
